They certainly are but it doesn't change the fact that more violent crime is perpetuated by the black community. I'm not saying that as my opinion it's true.
People in the system are racist but the system itself isn't. You can post articles like this that I half agree with all day long but the reason more black people get arrested is once again...they commit more violent crime.

According to statistics you are.
Then again that isn't what I was arguing.
I'm pointing out that besides the racial prejudice shown by some government officials and officers it's a fact that the black community commits more crime and not because their arrests are higher but because they in fact commit more murder, assault, abuse, etc whatever it is the crime stats are there.
Now I don't think skin color should play a role in how punishment is doled out but it's ignorant to think that the only reason there are more black people arrested is because the system is racist. The people in the system are racist and black people happen to commit more violent crime.

They upped the jump scares. They had a director who wanted to honor the book but he was replaced with a more "Hollywood friendly" director because they didn't think the original script for the reboot would make money it was considered too psychological.

Are you less likely to be arrested for drug offense because you're white or because you participate less in crime?
I understand there are many attitudes towards certain communities but one undeniable fact is the crazy high crime rate in areas populated by black people.
Is it because cops just arrest them more OR is it because they actually do commit more crime? Having lived in the hood I'd say it's the latter. Being black is one thing but slinging crack is another.

No, I want to ban a specific type of post. I think it's silly we see the same "Rare with a pun name." post every day. It's low effort and adds nothing to the sub-reddit.
Fluff has it's place and it's purpose but this kind of fluff sucks. If we banned things or posts I didn't like there would be a lot more banned than just sub-par puns, this isn't about my personal likes and dislikes.

You must not be reading my message correctly.
I don't want it banned because I don't like it...if we banned things I didn't like we would barely have Reddit at all lol.
I think it shouldn't be allowed because it's a low effort post copying a joke that has been told a thousand times already. That's my reasoning, don't put words in my posts.

Why? Because I have an opinion?
I don't think it's funny, it's super low effort, and gets upvoted to the top every time. It's old, it's done, I've seen it a thousand times.
It's my opinion and that is all.

I know people come here to discuss Diablo, did I ever say they didn't?
And I never specified what kind of posts should be posted only a particular one I think shouldn't be allowed because it gets posted every day and the joke is old.
I like how you think me disagreeing with the general consensus is me being condescending. I'm perfectly chill, I just literally think this is low effort posting and shouldn't be allowed.

No, I wouldn't and I stand by my statement.
Repetitive jokes and meme culture are not my bag and I think they are low effort jokes.
It's cool when you're with friends but to log in to Reddit every day and see a slightly different variation of the same fucking joke over and over again is ridiculous.
The community may not agree with me but I think it's lower than low effort and should not be allowed. It's like reposting but worse.

I understand people have deep religious feelings on the subject but these feelings are comparable to people who see ghosts, aliens, the future, etc.
This is like making a law where you're not allowed to make fun of someone's imaginary friend because it might hurt their little feelings.
